meanings.sent1: The rurps from the construction site woke me up early.
meanings.sent2: The thunder made a loud rurps that echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The rurps of the car horn startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The rurps of the fireworks filled the night sky with bursts of sound.
meanings.sent5: The rurps of the alarm clock was so jarring, it made me jump out of bed.

meanings.definition: Rurps (verb): to make a loud, unpleasant noise
meanings.sent1: The old door rurps loudly whenever it's opened.
meanings.sent2: The engine of the truck rurps noisily as it struggles up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to rurps by blowing bubbles in their milk.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to rurps through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The kettle started to rurps, signaling that the water was boiling.

meanings.definition: Rurps (adjective): describing a loud, unpleasant noise
meanings.sent1: The rurps sound of the broken fan was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The rurps music blared from the car parked outside.
meanings.sent3: The rurps squeak of the rusty swing set made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The rurps roar of the lion could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The rurps crash of the waves against the rocks was mesmerizing.
